page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN CURDWORTH AREA
page.content: CURDWORTH, WATER ORTON AND FARMS LINK WITH LANES CONVERGING ON TO TRUNK ROADS TO BIRMINGHAM, LICHFIELD, TAMWORTH, DERBY. THE M42 IS PROGRESSING AND WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL ACCESS. ONLY ONE BUS SERVICE ALONG BIRMINGHAM-TAMWORTH ROUTE MAKES IT DIFFICULT FOR CURDWORTH RESIDENTS TO REACH COLESHILL, WATER ORTON, SUTTON COLDFIELD, ESPECIALLY AFTER LOSS OF PRIVATE SINGLE DECKER BUS. WATER ORTON HAS TWO SERVICES TO COLESHILL, CHELMSLEY WOOD AND BIRMINGHAM. WATER ORTON'S 1908 RAILWAY STATION WON AWARDS FOR NEATEST STATION ON BIRMINGHAM-LEICESTER-PETERBOROUGH LINE, THROUGH EXPRESS TRAINS TO DERBY AND YORK COMMUTERS LEAVE CARS IN STATION CAR PARK. THOMAS TELFORD BUILT THE 200 YEARS OLD BIRMINGHAM-FAZELEY CANAL WHICH JOINS THE GRAND UNION CANAL AT SALFORD JUNCTION.
